{{ja-kanjitab|なべ|yomi=k}}
Originally a compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=なべ}} elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=なべ|肴|tr1=na|t1=small snack, hors d'oeuvre|瓮|tr2=he|t2=a pot or pan for holding food or beverages}}. {{rendaku2|sort=なべ|he|be}}

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|なべ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|なべ}}

# a broad-bottomed {{l|en|pot}} or {{l|en|pan}}
#: This term is less specific than English {{m|en|pot}} or {{m|en|pan}}, and can often be used to refer to either of these. The sample images at right illustrate some of the various items that can be called a ''nabe'' in Japanese.
# short for {{l|ja|鍋物|tr=''nabemono''}}, a {{l|en|dish}} where everything is cooked together in a ''nabe''; compare English {{m|en|hot pot}} or {{m|en|hotdish}}
#: ⇒ {{l|ja|鍋物|tr=''nabemono''}}
# by extension from the sense of someone working with pots and pans, a {{l|en|maidservant}}
#: ⇒ {{l|ja|御鍋|tr=''onabe''}}

====Related terms====
* {{ja-r|釜|かま}}: a big {{l|en|pot}}, a {{l|en|kettle}} or {{l|en|boiler}}
* {{ja-r|御釜|おかま}}: a {{l|en|maidservant}}; {{qualifier|slang}} one's {{l|en|butt}}; {{qualifier|slang}} a {{l|en|gay}} man
* {{ja-r|御鍋|おなべ}}: a {{l|en|maidservant}}; {{l|en|nightwork}}; {{qualifier|slang}} a {{l|en|lesbian}}
